etymologies: early 20th century: from modern Latin Giardia (from the name of Alfred M. Giard (1846–1908), French biologist) + -asis

definitions: infection of the intestine with a flagellate protozoan, which causes diarrhea and other symptoms.

notes.text: The protozoan is Giardia lamblia, phylum Metamonada, kingdom Protista

shortDefinitions: infection of intestine with flagellate protozoan, which causes diarrhoea and other symptoms
